snippet: The bill, aimed at limiting patronage and political interference, passed both legislatures unanimously but was vetoed by Govs. Chris Christie of New Jersey and Andrew M. Cuomo of New York.
abstract: New Jersey Senate fails to override Gov Chris Christie's veto of legislation aimed at limiting patronage and political interference at Port Authority of New York and New Jersey in wake of scandal over George Washington Bridge lane closings.
lead_paragraph: The bill, aimed at limiting patronage and political interference, passed both legislatures unanimously but was vetoed by Govs. Chris Christie of New Jersey and Andrew M. Cuomo of New York.

headline.main: New Jersey Senate Upholds Christie’s Veto of Port Authority Curbs
headline.print_headline: Christie Veto of Port Agency Bill Is Upheld

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
